name: Brawlcrawl: A Tale of Booze 'n Brimstone
name_original: Brawlcrawl: A Tale of Booze 'n Brimstone
description:
Description: Vira is a half-demon drunkard, and boy she acts like it. The final keg of ale got stolen on transit to the tavern, and now its up to Vira to get it back. Build your combo and spend it wisely for maximum butt-kicking. Traverse through two different fantasy zones fighting the goblins and their brutes to make it to the Holy GrALE at the end. Have fun!

Controls (keyboard/gamepad):

Left-Click/West Button -> High Punch

Right-Click/South Button -> Low Kick

E/North Button -> Counter

Space/East Button -> Ability Explosion

For this play test, we'd like to know any of the following:

Q1. Did you feel engaged? Should there be another objective to make the game more interesting?

Q2. How do you feel about the music/sound effects? Any suggestions?

Q3. Does combat feel good? How can it feel better? Does the combo gauge feel engaging?

Q4. How much more content needs to be added for the game to feel complete in your opinion?

Q5. How did you feel about the games difficulty?

Q6. How do you like the visuals and feel of the two zones? Any suggestions or advice for improvement?

Q7. How does the game perform on your machine? Any issues with the visual effects?

Q8. For any other suggestions, please go crazy and let us know what could make the game the best it can be!

Note: 

In all playtest builds for the game, you can walk off of the staircase after the cave arena and fall for eternity. This was due to an oversight of invisible walls, so until the next build try not to do that :]

Mac build issue must follow this procedure to open the game: https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/apple-cant-check-app-for-malicious-software-mchleab3a043/mac

For Linux builds of the game, building on Windows and compressing it for download breaks the executable. Please follow this link for a quick fix until the next build: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50577473/unity-game-compiled-in-windows-doesn-t-open-in-mac.
